bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: List of publications, compiled by Philip Showalter Hench, [November 21, 1941]

div1.p: Hench lists government documents related to the yellow fever commission.

div1.head: List of publications, compiled by Philip Showalter Hench, [November 21, 1941]

list.item:
1. Report on the origin and spread of Typhoid Fever in the United
States Military Camps. During the Spanish War of 1898 by Walter Reed, Victor
Baughan and Edward O. Shakespeare, Washington, Government Printing Office, 1904 -
2 volumes.

2. U. S. Adjutant General's office, Havana Dept.--Annual Report of the
Commanding General 1898.
7. Annual Reports of the War Department for 1898.

12. Report of Brigadier General William Ludlow, U. S. Army, Military
Governor of Habana, 1899-1900.

13. Cuba, Military governor 1899 (John R. Brooke) Havana 1899. This
is listed as F 1751.C97 in the Library of Congress.

14. Cuba, Military governor, 1899 (John R. Brooke) Final report, Havana
1899. This is apparently different from the preceding and is listed
as F 1787.C953 in the Congressional Library.

15. Civil report of Major-General John R. Brooke, U. S. Army, Military
governor, island of Cuba. Washington, Gov't print. off. 1900 (Pub-
lished also in the Annual reports of the U. S. War Dept. 1899 V. 1,
pt. 6; also in 56th Cong., 1st Sess. House, Dec. 2.

16. Cuba, Military governor, 1899-1902 (Leonard Wood) Civil report
1899-1900. Havana 1901.

17. Report of the Military governor of Cuba on civil affairs (Dec. 20,
1899-Dec. 31, 1900) Washington, Govt. print. office, 1901 1902

18. Cuba, Military governor, 1899-1902 (Leonard Wood) Civil report of
the Military governor, 1901 Havana ? 1902.

19. Cuba, Military governor, 1899-1902 (Leonard Wood) Civil report of
Brigadier General Leonard Wood, Military governor of Cuba, 1901.
Washington, Gov't. printing off., 1902.

20. Chaille, Stanford E; Report of the Chairman, Havana Yellow Fever
Commission of 1879. Annual Report, U. S. National Board of Health,
1880, Government Printing Office, Washington, D. C. 1891.
